title: Ticket #1697: Enhance Hadoop documentation
description:
Give detailed information about interaction between Condor and Hadoop.

Give full list of configuration variables and their definitions.
remarks:
2011-Jan-19 11:35:43 by smoler:
Condor allows HDFS to run in DataNode (DN), NameNode (NN), BackupNode (BN), and ChekpointNode (CN) modes. As a limitation of standard distribution of HDFS version 0.21.0, only one BackupNode (BN) is allowed to register with Active NameNode (NN). When a BN registers with NN no other registrations from BNs or CNs will be accepted.

Changes to configuration variables:

HDFS_SERVICES is changed to HDFS_NODETYPE

HDFS_BACKUPNODE
The host address and port number for the HDFS BackupNode. There is no default value for this required variable. Defines the value of dfs.namenode.backup.address in the HDFS XML configuration (hdfs-site.xml).

HDFS_BACKUPNODE_WEB
The address and port number for the HDFS embedded web server within the BackupNode with the syntax of hdfs://host_address:portnumber. There is no default value for this required variable. Defines the value of dfs.namenode.backup.http-address in the HDFS XML configuration.

HDFS_NAMENODE_ROLE
If machine is selected to be NameNode then by a role should defined. Available options are ACTIVE, BACKUP, CHECKPOINT, and STANDBY. Default value is ACTIVE. STANDBY option is added for future expansion. If HDFS_NODETYPE is selected to be DataNode (HDFS_DATANODE) then this parameter is ignored.
